patterns_discovered.description: Systematic replacement of physical margin properties (ml/mr) with logical properties (marginInlineStart/marginInlineEnd) for better RTL language support
patterns_discovered.benefit: Improves internationalization and provides automatic direction-aware spacing

patterns_discovered.description: Single-file, single-property migration following a clear migration strategy
patterns_discovered.observation: Changes are surgical and targeted, reducing risk of unintended side effects

gotchas_discovered.description: Only the 'ml' property was migrated to 'marginInlineStart'. If the component also had 'mr' properties, they should be migrated to 'marginInlineEnd' for complete logical property coverage
gotchas_discovered.impact: Inconsistent property usage may limit RTL support benefits if other margin properties remain unconverted

gotchas_discovered.description: The commit message mentions 'replace ml/mr conditionals' but the diff shows only a single property migration without any conditional statement changes
gotchas_discovered.impact: Task description suggests broader conditional refactoring that may not be fully implemented

approach_outcome.execution_notes: Successfully migrated a single margin property from physical (ml) to logical (marginInlineStart) CSS property in the Layout component's main content area Box element

recommendations.recommendation: Verify complete migration scope - check if any 'mr' (marginRight) properties exist elsewhere in the Layout component that should also be migrated to 'marginInlineEnd'
Validate RTL layout rendering to ensure marginInlineStart properly replaces ml behavior in right-to-left language contexts
Consider batching similar logical property migrations across related components to maintain consistent application-wide patterns
Document the migration rationale and ensure team understands the benefits of logical CSS properties for international applications
